external.description:
Alt: Annie from Community doesn't understand why people get so paranoid about AI scraping their work in particular.

Do you think you've got a turn or phrase or line of code so magic and unique that it will make you a million bucks?

If so, I've got a bridge in Brookyln to sell you (or a wing of the White House).

You are not a beautiful and unique snowflake.

You are the same matter as the rest of us.

Your data is the same noise as everything else to AI.

It's not going to copy you accurately.

It's not going to learn that much from you.

Don't be paranoid it will steal your crown jewels.

They were cubic zirconium anyways.

Do consider what we all lose by being paranoid about LLMs.

The less we all share, the less _we all learn_.

The more we guard our knowledge, the smaller of a community we build.

The more we refuse to share anything out of fear of AI, the worse our life quality becomes.

AI paranoia will destroy you.

Don't let it.

Don't be paranoid.

Don't fear the machine or the reaper.

Just try to be helpful and share as much as you can.

After all, we can't take it with us.
external.title: a woman sits on a chair in front of a cart of binders with one labeled ' a ' on it

record.text:
#AI Paranoid will destroy ya.

If you want to know what I mean, long read in the alt text.
